title: Question forms
introduction: Do you know how to make questions? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
explanation: To make questions, we often put the verb before the subject. This is called inversion.
keyPoints: there is a question word (why, what, where, how, etc
other verbs in the present simple, we use the auxiliary verb do/does in the question
examples: Do you know how to make questions?
Look at these examples to see how questions are made.
How much does a train ticket cost?
If there is a question word (why, what, where, how, etc.
Questions in the present simple and past simple
For other verbs in the present simple, we use the auxiliary verb do/does in the question.
In some questions, who or what is the subject of the verb.
Who is knocking on the door?
